title: Joe Manchin
added: On a November 10, 2020 interview, Manchin stated that he doesn't "see the need for the D.C. statehood with the type of services that we're getting in D.C. right now" and that he is "not convinced that's the way to go". In regards to [[Puerto Rico]] statehood, Manchin stated that he is open to the discussion, but currently opposes it.<ref>{{cite web |title=CNN.com - Transcripts |url=http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/2011/10/nday.06.html |website=transcripts.cnn.com |access-date=8 January 2021}}</ref>

title: Joe Manchin
deleted: In 2006 and 2010, Manchin delivered commencement addresses at [[Wheeling Jesuit University]] and at [[Davis & Elkins College]], receiving honorary degrees from both institutions.

title: Joe Manchin
added: On February 4, 2021, Manchin voted against providing [[COVID-19 pandemic]] financial support to undocumented immigrants.<ref>{{cite web |title=U.S. Senate Roll Call Votes 117th Congress - 1st Session |url=https://www.senate.gov/legislative/LIS/roll_call_lists/roll_call_vote_cfm.cfm?congress=117&session=1&vote=00018 |website=senate.gov |publisher=U.S. Senate |access-date=February 5, 2021}}</ref>
